item.title: UAW 负责人抨击特朗普威胁取消电动汽车投资
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers）主席肖恩-费恩（Shawn Fain）周四表示，如果前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在11月5日的总统大选中获胜，并兑现其撤销《通货膨胀削减法案》（Inflation Reduction Act）及其对电动汽车投资的承诺，那么美国将有数十万个工作岗位岌岌可危。【原文：United Auto Workers President Shawn Fain on Thursday said hundreds of thousands of U.S. jobs were at stake if former President Donald Trump won the Nov. 5 presidential election and made good his promise to revoke the Inflation Reduction Act and its investments in electric vehicles.】

item.title: 辉瑞前高管不再支持 Starboard 竞选活动，Starboard 寻求调查
item.description: 对冲基金 Starboard Value 周四表示，该公司已要求辉瑞成立一个特别委员会，对两名前高管被迫公开宣布支持首席执行官阿尔伯特-布尔拉的指控进行调查。【原文：Starboard Value has asked Pfizer to set up a special committee to investigate allegations that two of its former senior executives were forced to publicly declare support for CEO Albert Bourla, the hedge fund said on Thursday.】

item.title: 世贸组织称，如果中东冲突得到控制，2025 年全球贸易将增长 3
item.description: 世界贸易组织周四上调了对今年全球贸易量的预测，并表示如果中东冲突得到控制，2025 年全球贸易量有可能进一步增长至 3%。【原文：The World Trade Organization on Thursday nudged up its forecast for global trade volumes this year and said a further pick up to 3% growth was likely in 2025, assuming Middle East conflicts are kept in check.】

item.title: 通用汽车为美国电动汽车车主提供新的家庭储能方案
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）周四表示，其通用能源部门将为电动汽车车主提供一种家庭储能方案，用于储存和传输太阳能，这也是该公司向潜在电动汽车车主推销产品的一部分。【原文：General Motors said Thursday its GM Energy unit is offering electric vehicle owners a home storage option to store and transfer solar energy, part of the company's sales pitch to potential EV owners.】

item.title: 9 月 CPI 通胀升温令美联储鸽派前景黯淡
item.description: 美国 9 月份消费者物价涨幅略高于预期，但通胀年增幅是 3 年半以来最小的，这可能使美联储下月再次降息。【原文：U.S. consumer prices rose slightly more than expected in September, but the annual increase in inflation was the smallest in more than 3-1/2 years, potentially keeping the Federal Reserve on track to cut interest rates again next month.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数在飓风 "海伦 "的扭曲影响下激增
item.description: 上周，新申请失业救济金的美国人数激增，部分原因是受到飓风海伦和波音公司持续近四周的罢工影响。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits surged last week, partially boosted by Hurricane Helene and furloughs at Boeing amid a nearly four-week-old strike at the U.S. planemaker.】

item.title: 通胀数据公布后，美联储下月将降息 25 个基点
item.description: 周四，在一份政府报告显示上月通胀率略高于预期之后，交易员们加大了对美联储将在11月降息25个基点的押注。【原文：Traders on Thursday added to bets the Federal Reserve will deliver a 25 basis point interest-rate cut in November after a government report showed inflation last month was a bit firmer than expected.】

item.title: 美国 9 月消费者价格涨幅略高于预期
item.description: 美国 9 月份消费者物价涨幅略高于预期，但通胀年增幅是 3 年半以来最小的，这可能使美联储下月再次降息。【原文：U.S. consumer prices rose slightly more than expected in September, but the annual increase in inflation was the smallest in more than 3-1/2 years, potentially keeping the Federal Reserve on track to cut interest rates again next month.】

item.title: 美国参议员沃伦呼吁对诺和诺德控股的康泰伦特交易进行审查
item.description: 美国参议员伊丽莎白-沃伦（Elizabeth Warren）要求反垄断监管机构密切审查诺和诺德控股股东将以 165 亿美元收购合同药品制造商康泰伦特的交易，称这可能会使该制药公司在减肥和肥胖症药物方面获得非法优势。【原文：U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren has asked antitrust regulators to closely scrutinize a $16.5 billion deal in which Novo Nordisk's controlling shareholder would acquire contract drug manufacturer Catalent , saying it may give the pharmaceutical company an unlawful advantage in weight loss and obesity drugs.】

item.title: 美联航认为波音罢工对 2025 年夏季航班计划和航线开通没有影响
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）的一位高层管理人员周四表示，该公司预计波音公司工厂工人的罢工不会对其明年夏季的航班计划（包括新航线的开通）产生任何影响。【原文：United Airlines does not expect a strike by factory workers at Boeing to have any impact on its flight schedule for next summer, including new route launches, a top executive at the carrier said on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧洲央行账目显示对进一步放宽政策持谨慎态度
item.description: 周四，欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）9 月 12 日政策会议的记录显示，决策者在上个月的会议上似乎对通胀下降感到满意，但考虑到国内价格压力依然存在，他们主张逐步放宽政策。【原文：European Central Bank policymakers appeared content with the drop in inflation when they met last month but argued for a gradual policy easing given lingering domestic price pressures, the accounts of their Sept 12 policy meeting showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，马斯克的 X 将规避具有里程碑意义的欧盟技术规则的要求
item.description: 直接了解此事的人士周四表示，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 公司将不会被指定为《数字市场法案》（Digital Markets Act）这一具有里程碑意义的欧盟科技规则下的守门人，因为该法案将要求 X 公司承担一系列繁重的义务。【原文：Elon Musk's X will not be designated as a gatekeeper under landmark EU tech rules known as the Digital Markets Act which would have subjected it to an onerous list of obligations, people with direct knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 阿根廷三位数的通胀率有所放缓，但资金短缺的工人仍在为支付账单而挣扎
item.description: 阿根廷的通货膨胀率高达三位数，居世界之首，目前通货膨胀率开始放缓，但这对居民来说并没有什么缓解作用，因为他们的工资没有变化，而基本商品的价格却飞涨，政府还削减了国家补贴。【原文：Argentina's triple-digit inflation, the world's highest, is starting to slow but this offers little relief for residents whose salaries have stayed the same while costs of basic goods sky-rocketed and the government slashed state subsidies.】

item.title: 房地产市场疲软，宜家降价后销售额下降 5
item.description: 瑞典经济型家居用品零售商宜家家居降价促销，以吸引更多的购物者，并维持其在日益萎缩的家居家具市场上的份额，此后宜家家居的年销售额下降了 5%，但它预计明年将出现复苏。【原文：IKEA annual sales fell 5% after the Swedish budget homeware retailer cut prices in a bid to attract more shoppers and maintain its share of a shrinking home furniture market, but it expects a recovery next year.】

item.title: 医疗保健初创企业 Suki 融资 7000 万美元，为医院打造人工智能助手
item.description: Suki是一家在医疗保健领域提供人工智能（AI）助手的初创公司，该公司告诉路透社，它已在D轮融资中筹集了7000万美元，因为投资者对该行业采用人工智能驱动的生成式应用下了赌注。【原文：Suki, a startup that offers to build artificial intelligence (AI) assistants in healthcare, has raised $70 million in a Series D round, the company told Reuters, as investors place bets on the adoption of generative AI-powered applications in the sector.】

item.title: 达美航空第四季度收入低于预期，股价下跌
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）周四预计，在美国总统大选即将到来的背景下，预计旅游支出将放缓，因此该公司的季度收入将大幅低于预期，从而导致其股价在收盘前下跌 6%。【原文：Delta Air Lines on Thursday forecast quarterly revenue largely below expectations in anticipation of slower travel spending against the backdrop of the upcoming U.S. presidential election, sending its shares down 6% before the bell.】

item.title: 消息人士称，印度航空公司购买 85 架空中客车喷气机，并可能增加波音喷气机
item.description: 行业消息人士称，印度航空公司正在继续急转直下，新订购了 85 架空中客车飞机，并可能在去年历史性订购欧洲和美国喷气式飞机的基础上购买更多波音喷气式飞机。【原文：Air India is continuing a dramatic turnaround by placing a new order for 85 Airbus planes and could buy more Boeing jets on top of an historic order for European and U.S. jets last year, industry sources said.】

item.title: 给我信用：用信用卡管理孩子的三种方法
item.description: 对许多父母来说，这是一种熟悉的、沉甸甸的感觉：把孩子作为授权用户加入借记卡或信用卡，然后在账单上看到一笔意外的消费。【原文：For many parents, it is a familiar, sinking feeling: Adding your kid as an authorized user to your debit or credit card – and then seeing a surprise purchase pop up on your statement.】

item.title: 多米诺比萨因需求停滞，可比销售额增幅低于预期
item.description: 多米诺比萨公司周四公布的美国第三季度同店销售额增幅低于预期，原因是消费者减少了外出就餐的开支。【原文：Domino's Pizza posted a smaller-than-expected rise in third-quarter U.S. same-store sales on Thursday as consumers curbed spending on dining out.】

item.title: AMD 可能在旧金山数据中心活动上推出新的人工智能芯片
item.description: 先进微器件公司（Advanced Micro Devices）预计将于本周四在旧金山举行的一次活动上宣布几款新的人工智能处理器和其他芯片。【原文：Advanced Micro Devices is expected to announce several new artificial intelligence processors and other chips at an event in San Francisco on Thursday, as it grows as a supplier of AI chips in a market dominated by Nvidia .】

item.title: BMO 为美国葡萄酒部门注入新活力，押注行业复苏
item.description: 加拿大蒙特利尔银行（Bank of Montreal）的负责人表示，该行正将赌注押在美国葡萄酒销售的复苏上，通过增加招聘和重点关注富裕人士来加强其去年斥资 160 亿美元收购西部银行（Bank of the West）后获得的业务。【原文：Canada's Bank of Montreal is betting on a recovery in U.S. wine sales, juicing up the business it acquired through last year's $16-billion purchase of Bank of the West with more hiring and a focus on wealthy individuals, the unit's head said.】

item.title: 卡马拉-哈里斯获胜或将推动美国遏制向消费者征收 "垃圾费 "的努力
item.description: 打击范围可能扩大到数十亿美元的抵押贷款、信用报告和其他费用。【原文：A crackdown could expand to target billions of dollars in mortgage, credit reporting and other fees.】

item.title: 谁是 "先买后付 "借款人，他们在买什么？
item.description: 本周，亚马逊的 "Prime Day "活动拉开了假日购物季的序幕，根据数据公司Adobe Analytics的预测，美国消费者在今年最后一个季度使用 "先买后付 "方式购物的花费预计将达到创纪录的185亿美元。【原文：As Amazon's Prime Day kicked off the holiday shopping season this week, U.S. consumers are expected to spend a record $18.5 billion using buy now, pay later for purchases in the last quarter of the year, according to projections by data firm Adobe Analytics.】

item.title: 特斯拉豪赌机器人轴的 "黑盒 "人工智能技术
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）十年来一直未兑现提供自动驾驶汽车的承诺，而特斯拉（Tesla）的目标是在周四晚推出期待已久的 "机器人出租车"，让投资者为之震惊。【原文：Tesla aims to stun investors Thursday night with its long-awaited “robotaxi unveil," a potential milestone after a decade of Elon Musk’s unfulfilled promises to deliver self-driving vehicles.】

item.title: 美国 风暴过后股票创下新纪录，CPI 也将公布
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 期货在关键通胀数据公布前下跌
item.description: 美国股指期货周四下跌，因为投资者正在等待一份备受期待的通胀报告，预计该报告将进一步明确今年剩余时间的货币政策方向。【原文：U.S. stock index futures declined on Thursday as investors braced for a highly anticipated inflation report, which is expected to provide more clarity on the monetary policy direction for the remainder of the year.】

item.title: 中国就对台武器销售问题对3家美国公司和10名高管实施制裁
item.description: 中国外交部周四宣布，就美国向台湾出售武器一事对三家与美国军方有关联的公司和十名高级管理人员实施制裁。【原文：China's foreign ministry on Thursday announced it had imposed sanctions on three U.S. military-linked firms and 10 senior excecutives over U.S. weapons sales to Taiwan.】

item.title: 日本央行副行长绯野表示，如果对预测更有信心，日本央行将加息
item.description: 日本央行副行长绯野良造（Ryozo Himino）周四表示，如果董事会对经济和价格预测的实现 "更有信心"，央行将考虑提高利率。【原文：Bank of Japan Deputy Governor Ryozo Himino said on Thursday the central bank will consider raising interest rates if the board has "greater confidence" that its economic and price forecasts will be realised.】

item.title: 希腊表示，埃克森美孚牵头的财团将继续在克里特岛附近进行天然气地震研究
item.description: 希腊周四表示，以埃克森美孚为首的财团将进入第二阶段的地震研究，以便在希腊克里特岛附近的一个区块进行天然气勘探。【原文：An ExxonMobil-led consortium will move to the second phase of seismic research for gas exploration in a block off the Greek island of Crete, Greece said on Thursday.】

item.title: 全球需求降温，中国 9 月出口可能进一步放缓
item.description: 中国 9 月份的出口增速可能是 5 个月来最慢的，这表明制造商不再急于在几个贸易伙伴加征关税之前发出订单，而且全球对中国商品的需求正在疲软。【原文：China's exports are likely to have risen at the slowest pace in five months in September, suggesting manufacturers are no longer rushing out orders ahead of tariffs from several trade partners and that global demand for Chinese goods is softening.】
